intro: Hymenoxys odorata, commonly known as the sweetroot or Mexican milkweed, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features a taproot system and produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are alternate, lance-shaped, and covered in fine hairs, while the stems are hairy and often reddish in color. Hymenoxys odorata is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky soils and open woodlands.
